title.text: Improving Automatic Indexing through Concept Combination and Term Enrichment

abstractContent.text: Although indexes may overlap, the output of an automatic indexer is generally presented as a fiat and unstructured list of terms.
Our purpose is to exploit term overlap and embedding so as to yield a substantial qualitative and quantitative improvement in automatic indexing through concept combination.
The increase in the volume of indexing is 10.5% for free indexing and 52.3% for controlled indexing.
The resulting structure of the indexed corpus is a partial conceptual analysis.

datasetContent.text: Qualitative evaluation: The volume of indexing is characterized by the surface of the text occupied by terms or their combinations--we call it the conceptual surface.
